title: Three-second review of Riot's new champions

replies.body:
Kai'Sa - Overloaded
Pyke - Overloaded
Sylas - Overloaded

Neeko - I think she's OK.

Sylas has some pretty versatile tools, but I wouldn't say he's overloaded, if only because the damage he can get from his own spells is abysmal.

* His passive does less damage per hit than Kayle's E.
* His Q does impressive damage if you land both parts, but is sub-par if you only land one of them (plus the animation is hella long, stopping you from getting passive procs immediaetly).
* His W damage is pathetic even when empowered.
* His E damage is even more pathetic, though you don't exactly take it for the damage so w/e.

Sylas is only as strong as his enemy's ults, because without a good one he sucks ass.
Bad numbers =/= not overloaded.

Neeko ult alone has 
-a shield
-can move/flash during it
-HUGE damage
-HUGE ratio
-HUGE AoE
-stuns every target hit

that alone is the entire kit of Annie in a single ability.

1) Her shield is only during her Airborne status. Far cry difference from an Unstoppable to serve the same purpose.

2) Her movement acts as a way to signal to opponents how to get away, which they do 80% of the time. Flash is generally the only way to succeed her ult, which means she has no Flash outside her ult.

3) Damage is reduced by resist the same as any other magic, and since so much of her power is forced into it, it means by mitigating one skill, you grossly cripple the rest of her.

4) The AP and Base damage is far less than Nunu and several other champs with similar skills when all kit points are considered. it also offers less CC.

5) The aoe is easy to avoid.

6) After 2 seconds.... at which point they have plenty of time to get away.

And no. Its nothing at all like Annie's kit:

-Instant Stun with no chance to avoid it on either her Q, or R.
-Annie gets a minion.
-Annie can mitigate 40% damage.

Nah. They really don't. It's just that people who call foul generally are louder and more prolific than the people who actually try out the champs, assess their strengths and weaknesses, and then learn to counterplay them.

There's a reason why most "OP New champs" don't have high win rates; Even if on a micro level, their kits duel well and are hard to react to, the tradeoff is they do not have an impression on their game's success on a macro level. That's why even with a double Siphoning Strike, Nasus really hasn't changed much. He's still a single target champion who only gains as much as one auto attack will let him. In contrast, more successful champs have aoes, faster move speeds in their builds, and can get away from a lane to help their teams.

Pyke is also a single target champion who on a micro level performs "well" on the surface. But, when you break down what he actually does, his statistics do not support his KDAs. He is essentially a "finisher" 90% of the time, and only 10% duel. His kit has some of the lowest damage output in the game, only hits once per skill, the CC is brief, and much of it is easy to mitigate. So, most Pykes just wait around for teammates to start fights, and help finish those fights at less than 30-20% HP. He may have a good KDA, but generally underperforms in objectives, actual damage, and even CC, because his Q has conditions, he is easy to kill, and E doesn't happen enough to champions per game.

Zoe was never at any point broken. In fact her win rate only went up after her 4th nerf, which moved some of her E and Passive damage into her W, and gave her a higher level 1 move speed on W, drastically reducing her Q/E damage output in the process. (I had a team last night that just kept stepping right on her Bubbles after they had been on the ground 1-1.5 seconds, who we had to block the shot for so many times, but that doesn't make her broken; that makes my teammates stupid). The size of her Q and linear nature of play and the weak structure of her R just makes her easy to kill/shut down/take out of a game. She's predictable, unless you use a ton of summoners around her. Which is also the opponent's ignorance.

Neeko is balanced as hell. Her R in exchange for large hits, is VERY hard to actually hit. You maybe hit it 2-3 times a game, unless a team is constantly trying to kill Neeko, and Neeko has a Zhonya's...... which also makes that team dumb. That's not Neeko being OP. That's the opponents Risking a Zhonya's into a mechanic they SHOULD KNOW. Her E rarely ever gets its full duration root, and her Q is easy to walk out of, and each hit is smaller than the average mage's hits.

Have you also noticed, that other than Pyke, all these champs have a really low play rate? If they were OP, they wouldn't be shelved. Especially with how fun, cute, and visually designed Neeko and Zoe are.

Probably just semantics but problematic =/= broken. Problematic champions = unfun, frustrating, and consume bans of champions who probably actually deserve the ban because a lot of times you login and think "I just don't want to deal with Yasuo's windwall bullshit today." 

Not to downplay your post, but I agree with you on Neeko, she's really well balanced. I disagree on Pyke and release Zoe, but my thoughts are most "OP New Champs" have poor win rate because they are new. In my opinion, newer champions tend to have completely overloaded kits, and are poorly power-budgeted. The rest of Akali's kit HAD to be underwhelming because they put so much into her shroud. 

Their low play rate and proof of their problematic states is their crazy high ban rate 

Akali is at a 46% ban rate in Plat +

Pyke at a 32%

You do realize with the exception of Pyke, every one of them has a detrimental win rate....

Ban rate only expresses micro frustration. The reason high elo bans Akali is because they have 4 other champions to deal with, and dealing with her takes too much focus. She's not OP. She just devotes way too much attention. High elos try to ban "luck" encounters, because the 3-4 times Akali succeeds per game, may very well be a lane push.

Zoe was sub 43% Win rate 6 months after her release. That's not a symptom of "New champion"
Pyke isn't new. He's 48%.
Irelia is dominating when a lane gives her a lead, but what top champ isn't? Played against a fed Renekton recently? or a fed Darius? Or a fed Garen? they have the same pressure/influence over a game. 

Bottom line: Ban rates are indicative of a player base wanting easy, direct kills, not about who kills them, when in high elo. They will ban the people with the most mobility, even if they do not have influential damage.

In high elo we ban counters or champions who are just plain broken. Yasuo's banrate is indicative of one or both of two things: 1) noone wants to play against him or/and 2) he counters a ton of champions.

1) That was prior to the major rework/nerfs. At that point, the only major change was the removal of her E's cooldown reduction. Her nerfs "to the ground" - her conversion of sleep into a Cleanse/QSS/Tenacity CC was after that, as was her reallocation of damage.

2) Her R can miss and is pretty easy to predict. It's her 3 X Reset on Q that carries her into a destructive pattern along with Steraks. Before the Sterak's she's manageable. But when she has that shield PLUS her Q's heals, she basically heals up while shielded and friggin resets the fight to where it began. If she's shut down, you can delay that Steraks, and she becomes more manageable.

3) Nah. There's more factors on aggregate at high elo than just how someone feels about a champion (or at least for me). It's about reducing the game to champs who can be caught, don't reset, and are easy to force into a position where your team can push their base without them being able to stop it. These new mobility champs throw a wrench into that basic concept, because they avert more punishment, have many resets, and just take too much time to deal with. Just think about how long it takes to kill a good Yasuo, vs the risk/reward for doing so. Personally, I can counter Yasuo with Zyra in DII, but it's still a really annoying matchup, because the extra 10-12 seconds I'm fighting Yasuo reduces my presence elsewhere, or pushing a turret. it's MUCH easier if they run a Veigar or Karthus, and I can just pop them. At best, they can Zhonya's. They don't have 10 ways to dodge my skill shots or a Wind Wall to block my E.

You have an overexaggerated sense of what a smurf can do in the current elo. You can win a lane with a nonmeta champ, but you still have to be building something viable. And winning a lane doesn't mean winning the game, because smurfing doesn't address the potential feed advantage your team gives the other team. If you're playing Blitz Top, building him AP or AD, and your team is losing mid 0/6 and bot lane 1/12, and your jungler is just "jungling" the entire game, your options to win are still finite. Blitz specifically usually gets singled out, and if he DOES miss a hook, he's usually a sitting duck for awhile. A fed other team can still win that, and his kit doesn't have resets or serious aoe presence.

Smurfs who want to win smurfing stick to reset champs like Irelia, Jax, Kha Zix, Jarvan, Lee Sin, Katarina, Fiora, or high scaling assassins like Talon or Zed these days. They don't clown play unless they are trying to derank and have some fun doing it (They'll win lane but lose game)
